title: Publisher Rocket - Full Tutorial on How to Use Publisher Rocket for KDP 2024

tactics.name: Keyword Research with Publisher Rocket
tactics.description: Use Publisher Rocket's keyword search tool to analyze market data and identify profitable niches.
steps: Enter target keywords into the keyword search feature
Analyze metrics like competitors, price, and search volume
Select keywords with optimal competitive scores
caveats: May not capture long-tail keyword opportunities
source_quotes: Publisher Rocket will give us some core data...create a book

tactics.name: Keyword Competition Analysis
tactics.description: Use Publisher Rocket to evaluate keyword competitiveness via color-coded scores (green=low competition, red=high competition).
steps: Input keywords into Publisher Rocket's keyword search tool
Filter data by average pages, price, and monthly earnings
Identify green-scored keywords with low competition
caveats: When keyword search returns insufficient data
source_quotes: if we get a match of a green here and compare this score of a green that's great competitive score we have say green which is low competition

tactics.name: Competitor Analysis
tactics.description: Use Publisher Rocket to identify competing books, check their rankings, sales, and categories.
steps: View competitor books' BSR (Book Sales Rank) and sales
caveats: Data may lag behind real-time Amazon updates

tactics.name: Category Growth Analysis
tactics.description: Identify categories with declining or rising sales using Publisher Rocket insights to inform KDP book selection.
steps: Use Publisher Rocket's category search to filter niches
source_quotes: this category has a high variation only a few best sellers might be driving its growth

tactics.name: Keyword Research
tactics.description: Leverage Publisher Rocket's keyword tool to identify high-potential search terms for Amazon ads and book optimization.
steps: Input niche categories into keyword search
Analyze keyword competition and search volume
Integrate keywords into Amazon ad campaigns
source_quotes: these are keywords that you might like to use in your seven back-ended keywords

heuristics.name: Low Competition Opportunity
heuristics.condition: If estimated_amazon_searches < 1000 and competitive_score < 60, then flag as low competition

heuristics.name: Page One Ranking Priority
heuristics.condition: If a book appears on page one of search results, it receives 270% more clicks than a book on position six
source_quotes: 270 people will click on the book that shows up at the top but only 60 will click on a book that shows up at number six

heuristics.name: Review Threshold Boost
heuristics.condition: If a book has fewer than 200 reviews, prioritize it for optimization.

heuristics.name: Low Competition Filter
heuristics.condition: If a category has fewer than 200 reviews and BSR over 50,000, prioritize it for KDP publishing
source_quotes: this category has a high variation only a few best sellers might be driving its growth

claims.statement: Publisher Rocket offers a free 12-hour KDP course with purchase
source_quotes: exclusive 12-hour Amazon KDP course...get for free

claims.statement: Books on page one of Amazon search results receive significantly more clicks than those on subsequent pages
source_quotes: 270 people will click on the book that shows up at the top but only 60 will click on a book that shows up at number six

claims.statement: Amazon has over 12,000 categories and subcategories.
source_quotes: there are over 12,000 categories and subcategories on Amazon

claims.statement: 52% of Publishers in the 'parenting relationships' category are part of Kindle Unlimited
source_quotes: 49% of Publishers 52 are in Kindle unlimited

niche_patterns.description: Target specific demographics with unique challenges and preferences
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Combines identity (teen boys) with problem (ADHD) and constraint (Christian values)
source_quotes: life skills for teenage girls...young adults Twins
